title: Analysis of Explanation-Inducing Prompt Effects in Simulation-Based Online Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Over five years of practical experience in the relevant field (medical/legal/technical)
context.additional_context: Teaching competency enhancement program for pre-service or in-service teachers, featuring digital device-enabled environments for self-directed learning

learning_goals: Learners can accurately explain core concepts by over 85% by applying self-explanation prompts using the SCAMPER technique during simulation tasks.
Learners can identify logical flaws in problem-solving processes by over 70% according to explanation-inducing prompt types provided in formative assessments.
Learners can select and apply optimal explanation strategies during simulation-based learning, considering prior knowledge and cognitive load.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
